title: Nicole Scherzinger ordered to 'take a back seat' for Pussycat Dolls reunion
text:

The Pussycat Dolls are coming back – and Nicole Scherzinger has been firmly told her time to shine is over, according to reports.

The chart topping American band - consisting of 41-year-old Nicole, Carmit Bachar, 45, Jessica Sutta, 37, Kimberly Wyatt, 37, Ashley Roberts, 38, and Melody Thornton, 35 - enjoyed a string of hits between 2005 and 2009 including Don’t Cha, Beep, and Jai Ho! (You Are My Destiny).

Rumours are rife the ladies are about to embark on a comeback a decade after they last released their song Hush Hush; Hush Hush.

However the band were dogged with rumours or rivalry and animosity in the past, with many band members feeling they were overshadowed by Nicole - who enjoyed the majority of the Dolls’ spotlight, and lead vocals.

(Image: WWD/REX)

Now, it seems, the group are insisting the unofficial ‘leader’ of the band take a back seat for their reunion.

"Before they took a break in 2009, Nicole had become the lead singer of the group,” a source told The Sun.

"It felt natural at the time but now they’re starting planning the tour, some of the girls have demanded Nicole take a back seat,” the source continued.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Reuters)

“In the old days, Nicole became the stand-out star next to Melody Thornton, Kimberly Wyatt, Ashley Roberts, Carmit Bachar and Jessica Sutta. But for the reunion, the women want it to be more of a level playing field,” the source went on.

Melody in particular has been singled out as the band member who is pushing for “talks” to happen before anyone can sign on for a reunion.

The source claims: "“Melody’s camp have pushed for talks to iron out all the kinks beforehand."

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: Grant Buchanan / SplashNews.com)

While Nicole herself is said to be taking a "laid back" approach to the apparent reunion and is keen for the other ladies to have their moment to shine.

The group have thus far appeared to downplay that a reunion will happen - and, indeed, Carmit herself appears to be focusing on her own performing, currently gearing up to perform at Latino Pride in Phoenix later this month.

Meanwhile Kimberly (who is married to British model Max Rogers) is preparing to give birth to her third child - with her due date just days away.

And Melody is currently enjoying musical success of her own - featuring on a new single called Freak Like Me by Harrison.
description: The other ladies are concerned that the vocal powerhouse will overshadow them all again if the band gets back together
